Articles.Content:
If you really don\'t care about space litter then post your screenies here.

Some random debris came within 1000 m on my previous orbit. And that\'s just the one I know of.
If you can accidentally hit another object at high speeds, you deserve Jeb\'s chin

Ppl say it is statistically difficult (ie impossible) to hit random debris, but when you consider *EVERY* launch goes to a 125km equatorial orbit and leaves debris then the impossible becomes probable.

If you can accidentally hit another object at high speeds, you deserve Jeb\'s chin

I did that just last week. In the space of 5 seconds, I lost the middle of my Munar lander and my parachute. (The back half of my rocket took it off.)

I was facing retrograde, so I didn\'t notice until it hit... I think it was an RCS tank with attached thrusters. My screenshot finger didn\'t get there in time.

Why on Kerbin would someone eject a single spent rcs tank ???

Might it be that you purposefully littered the space around the planet with debris so it would eventually happen

Why on Kerbin would someone eject a single spent rcs tank ???

Might it be that you purposefully littered the space around the planet with debris so it would eventually happen

Actually, on one of my designs, i had to apply RCS tanks to the lander due to size issues, which are then seperated themselves when i need to use the lander, it results in 4 RCS tanks floating freely in space.
Honestly, I have nearly lost a rocket per three launches, from the amount of debris in LKO (Low Kerbol Orbit)

I only just edited my persistent file to get rid of the debris, but I had a bad design for an unmanned Minmus probe, and each one left a total of 9 stacks in a circular orbit around Kerbin, which eventually made equatorial orbits somewhat dangerous.

Edited May 18, 2017 by Dizzle

How do I clear debree?

I have confused my own orbits with others :/
I used to stay cluttered, but the autosave lag was getting annoying. As result, I clear the persistent file every once in a while or manually remove individual parts.
How Do I clear the persistence?, just delete it?
NNEEEOOOOOOOOO don\'t delete your persistance file! Just go into the settings and crank the debris to 0 and back up.
I have no persistance file and I never deleted it
